TONIGHT on @NBCNightlyNews: Pete Buttigieg pitches his #BigIdea.

It's the next installment in "My Big Idea," a series where @HarrySmith will interview the 2020 Democratic candidates about their major policy ideas ahead of the nomination. https://t.co/Ny7GkldkaV

State Sen. Adam Ebbin and Del. Mark Keam endorse Pete Buttigieg for president ahead of the South Bend mayor's appearance Saturday at Virginia Democrats' fundraiser in Richmond, @patrickmwilson reports.
https://t.co/M8BmvHWZDK
It doesn<U+2019>t matter how you get there<U+2026> https://t.co/fT957BufCm

At least one out of every three people living on tribal lands lacks high-speed internet, cutting them off from the modern world <U+2014> any infrastructure plan must include indigenous voices and needs.
https://t.co/uaGdnqA5GM

Change will not just happen. We need Congress to deliver on common-sense gun laws supported by an American majority, like universal background checks and a ban on military-style assault weapons. And we need every state to pass a hate crimes law.

Today we honor those lost at #Pulse. It wasn<U+2019>t an attack on just one community<U+2013>it was an attack on LGBTQ Americans, Latinx Americans, and Black Americans. It was an attack on people who look like me, and an attack on people who look nothing like me. It was an attack on all of us.

It was moving to witness part of today<U+2019>s march as clergy from @RevDrBarber to Rabbi @JonahPesner to the @SistersOfMercy, surrounded by lay people also motivated by faith and values, gathered against this Administration<U+2019>s repeated attacks on the vulnerable. https://t.co/NgrMTcho8z

President Trump and this Administration have stripped rights from the vulnerable, attacked the poor, and hurt our immigrant communities. The @RevDrBarber has assembled an interfaith coalition of leaders who are demanding a change.

An important thing happened today in Washington as #MoralWitnessWednesday and @Brepairers bore witness to the call of various faith traditions to speak out against injustice, to <U+201C>rescue victims from their exploiters.<U+201D> https://t.co/ORQBDOgQxk
Good conversation yesterday with #MayorPete #Buttigieg on #CriminalJusticeReform, #votingrights, #workforcedevelopment.  I was happy to welcome him to #EbenezerAtl. https://t.co/AnqIQpcSzr

As extremist leaders driven by the idols of racism, greed and power continue to break the covenant, faith leaders are marching together to the palace gates of the White House to deliver a clarion call! #MoralWitnessWednesday WATCH via livestream: https://t.co/Iustly5c6c https://t.co/3FTwoQmde0

Replacing racist policies with neutral ones will not deliver equality. Instead, we must actively work to reverse the persistent inequalities that have compounded over hundreds of years. They hold back our economy and corrode the American soul.

https://t.co/1N5ASD2IHK
The world needs an America free from entrapment in endless war and prepared to focus on future threats. https://t.co/yTnZ1qlrPV
The world needs America to lead on climate. https://t.co/QWfnMZzW70
https://t.co/nEGLQh6U5g

We must put an end to endless war and refocus on future threats. We must promote American values by working to reverse the rise of authoritarianism abroad. We must treat climate change as the existential security challenge it is. https://t.co/WZzwjfwUUv
https://t.co/TX8wsD6rso
https://t.co/wJOBhkJCZD
Join us live from Bloomington, Indiana for a discussion on national security for a new era: https://t.co/TBXW0xnTq5
Inspiring to see so many in Hong Kong marching peacefully this weekend. We must continue America<U+2019>s commitment to Hong Kong<U+2019>s openness, democratic values, and judicial independence.
Thanks to everyone who turned out for our picnic in Cedar Rapids before the @iowademocrats Hall of Fame dinner. https://t.co/etFupXmFR7

Suppressing intelligence on a major threat won<U+2019>t make it go away. Climate disruption is the mounting global security crisis of our time, and history will judge how we rise to meet this challenge. https://t.co/hljPnoegLx

My heart fell to the pit of my stomach when I clicked the hashtag and found panic instead of pride. Whether there was physical harm or not, there was most certainly trauma. Check in on your friends tonight. Know that you are loved and that we are here for you. #DCPride

Ten years ago, Varnum v. Brien made Iowa only the third state to legalize marriage equality. Watching today's vow renewals and anniversary celebrations reminds us that love is love. https://t.co/fuuQb9JChX

Thousands of patients in Iowa are struggling thanks to a limited medical marijuana program that doesn<U+2019>t meet their health care needs <U+2014> the governor<U+2019>s veto will only prolong their suffering.
https://t.co/jUN52FjldW

Our campaign is guided by a set of values: respect, belonging, truth, teamwork, boldness, responsibility, substance, discipline, excellence, and joy. Will you commit to these values, too?

https://t.co/W7XAukg3sx

Matthew Shepard's death forced America to confront deadly homophobia. Lifting up the next generation of LGBTQ leaders is a tribute to his life and legacy. It was an honor to participate in last night's presentation of Iowa's Matthew Shepard Scholarships. https://t.co/SUCp2iLbmj
Returning to Iowa always feels like coming home. If you're free this weekend, check out our list of events and join us on the campaign trail: https://t.co/joyiHpbMRm https://t.co/9ScbeOli4i

Historically Black Colleges and Universities account for 80% of Black judges, 50% of Black lawyers, and 25% of Black STEM degrees <U+2014> they deserve more dedicated financial support.

https://t.co/GsC7lvPFnz

Just one week after performing at Obama's inauguration in 2013, Hadiya Pendleton was killed just blocks from her school. She was 15. Today we #WearOrange to honor her and all victims of gun violence, and show unity around the insistence that this cannot remain our reality. https://t.co/jpKZzW2V7x

We<U+2019>ve got an amazing field of Democratic candidates, but I find @PeteButtigieg particularly inspiring and uniquely qualified to lead our country right now. Proud to support his campaign, and I hope you will, too. #gapol https://t.co/YZXaXFvaFg

When young black mothers are three times more likely to die in childbirth as white mothers, when diabetes and prostate cancer are more likely to go undiagnosed and to harm people in the black community, we know that freedom is being impaired because of racism in this country. https://t.co/KqaoHXgwPo

Less than two generations ago, Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. implored America from this pulpit to live up to its values. I appreciate Ebenezer Baptist Church's Rev. @RaphaelWarnock taking the time to show me such an important piece of our history. https://t.co/HA7AFMwgFk

As Democrats, we are lucky to have such a strong field running for President. But I believe @PeteButtigieg is uniquely qualified for this moment. I am honored to endorse him today and look forward to working to help make him our nominee. #WinTheEra My full statement below. https://t.co/tVXN3zmyPn
Thanks to @SHODesusAndMero for having me. Tune in tonight at 11:00 pm ET on @Showtime. https://t.co/JITrBpL0io

75 years ago, more than 156,000 Allied soldiers landed on Normandy Beach, including 73,000 Americans. It was their bravery that helped turn the tide against Nazism and Fascism abroad. To honor their heroism, let us continue to stand for freedom and democracy, abroad and at home.
Proud of our South Bend Youth Task Force members. Five years of @SBYTF students have helped give youth a voice in our community. https://t.co/qwiQDq78xB
From firefighter graduation to Future of Work, the Mayor<U+2019>s Office is on the move this morning! https://t.co/sUoalr8wjA

Dozens of children, already traumatized by forced separation, were left in vans for two nights during this Administration<U+2019>s botched family reunifications <U+2014> the cruelty and incompetence on display here is unconscionable.

https://t.co/6tPJC3svbe

Today we honor those who sacrificed their lives and livelihoods for freedom and democracy in Tiananmen Square. And for those still fighting, from the Uighurs of Xinjiang to China<U+2019>s courageous activists, publishers, lawyers, students, and feminists: We see you. We're with you.

In our new series '20 Questions for 2020,' we talk to the candidates to find out who they are, why they<U+2019>re running, & where they stand on the issues that matter most

First up: Mayor @PeteButtigieg on religion in politics, how to fix democracy, & whether hot dogs are sandwiches https://t.co/0HqzsFY7Wt

When politicians are allowed to pick their constituents, they too often place themselves beyond accountability <U+2014> that's why I'm joining @EricHolder and taking @demredistrict<U+2019>s pledge to support fair districts and end manipulation.
#EidMubarak to all those celebrating <U+2014> may you and your families rejoice on this Eid al-Fitr.

We are living in racist systems today. And that's why in entrepreneurship, in homeownership, in health, in education, of course in criminal justice -- that we have to systematically reverse that. https://t.co/9Q7K6e1STs
By the way, a tariff is a tax. So if you ever believe the Republicans don't raise taxes, that's what they're doing right now. https://t.co/VtGHRaT64P

"If you<U+2019>re elected President of the United States, what would you say to Vladimir Putin the first time you met him?" - @HardballChris

"Well, don<U+2019>t mess with our elections." https://t.co/JpXaweIlrN
10 minutes until our <U+2066>@MSNBC<U+2069> town hall with <U+2066>@PeteButtigieg<U+2069> here in Fresno https://t.co/9JEtVDcx9b

Our campaign team gathered in South Bend last week to ground ourselves in our values. This hardworking, talented, and diverse group of colleagues is ready to win the era. And our team is growing <U+2014> join us: https://t.co/wKXsMHTeco https://t.co/tKMRU4w7DA

Thanks to leaders like Marsha P. Johnson and Harvey Milk, I have faith in the possibility of change and growth in this country. There is still more work to do, but let us take a moment and celebrate the gains we've made this #PrideMonth.

1/ Happy #PrideMonth!

This year, @HRC is celebrating 50 years of #Pride, and two momentous anniversaries in #LGBTQ history: the 50th anniversary of the uprising at #Stonewall in 1969 and the first Pride parade a year later. #Stonewall50 #Pride2019 https://t.co/uc3FOEmAh0
"There is no such thing as an honest politics that revolves around the word 'again.'" - @PeteButtigieg #CADem2019

MONDAY: Pete Buttigieg joins us live from @Fresno_State for a Hardball town hall. 

Tune in at 7 PM ET on MSNBC. #PetePlaysHardball https://t.co/eBgqOupn0O

Another horrific shooting shocks the nation, this time in Virginia Beach. We grieve with those impacted even as we await more information. Already, this much is clear: it is unacceptable for America to remain the only developed country where this is routine. We must act.

Thanks to everyone who came out for tonight<U+2019>s Mayor<U+2019>s Night Out at @sbcivic, covering everything from potholes to workforce development. South Bend<U+2019>s strong level of civic involvement and participation was on full display! https://t.co/vOHCXAmQB7

NH today sent a clear message on criminal justice reform. The death penalty as applied in America has always been a discriminatory practice, and the country would be fairer and safer if we joined the ranks of modern nations who have abolished it. https://t.co/gGFXHKfIUy

The census is not a sexy topic, but this is serious. There<U+2019>s further evidence of partisan and racial motivations behind this tampering. It<U+2019>s another attack on fair democracy, and it matters. https://t.co/GudkjCBWfF
This is not a show. Our military is not a prop. Ships and sailors are not to be toyed with for the benefit of a fragile president<U+2019>s ego. https://t.co/plI68Yplp5

Matthew 25:35-36 

For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in, I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me. https://t.co/eW2Sl34J88

This is as close to an impeachment referral as it gets. Robert Mueller could not clear the president, nor could he charge him <U+2014> so he has handed the matter to Congress, which alone can act to deliver due process and accountability.
Congratulations to my friend @harrisonjaime on officially launching his campaign to unseat Lindsey Graham in SC. He will make a great Senator<U+2014>and a positive change. https://t.co/zFD7m1FEjf

A just economy depends on strong unions to defend working people. Proud of @PGHHospitalWork for standing up for their right to a union, fair wages, and affordable health care. #UnionsForAll https://t.co/WNrXFM2SXO

Tonight on #Hardball: @HardballChris hosts from South Bend and talks to @PeteButtigieg! Tune in for his interview at 7 PM ET. Here<U+2019>s some behind the scenes photos. (<U+0001F4F8>: @JuliaEClancy) https://t.co/8RorUYnfjm

We asked Dem presidential candidates to honor the true meaning of today. Here is what they sent. We thank them all, and remember all those we lost in war. Thanks to @NowThisNews for their help with this! https://t.co/WaJs4jhs0y
Memorial Day is set aside for remembering the war dead of this country. It's important for us to pause, step aside, and honor the sacrifice that makes American life possible. https://t.co/HMdT5fJ8UJ
Sunday mood https://t.co/gK0SLJ5jZv
https://t.co/MD6FgEpUBb

Pete Buttigieg to @MarthaRaddatz: "It's a continuing horror show right now in Washington. And you have a president who has turned the entire thing into a reality show. We've got to completely change the channel" https://t.co/LqbnX8uTU4 https://t.co/aezhrOO1t6

Pete Buttigieg on President Trump: "You have somebody who thinks it's alright to let somebody go in his place into a deadly war, and is willing to pretend to be disabled in order to do it. That is an assault on the honor of this country" https://t.co/LqbnX8uTU4 https://t.co/YBcQfr4Vsz

Pete Buttigieg criticizes Pres. Trump<U+2019>s meeting with Kim Jong Un, saying it gave North Korea <U+201C>legitimacy.<U+201D>

<U+201C>The way diplomacy works, the way deals work, is you give someone something in return for something... it hasn<U+2019>t worked at all.<U+201D> https://t.co/LqbnX8uTU4 https://t.co/VlSIN7OUSR

In just the last year we<U+2019>ve seen violations in states including Georgia, Texas, Ohio & Florida. This week was the anniversary of a law that is, even now, being slowly chipped away. We cannot build a more perfect union unless we first build a democracy that includes every citizen.

But in the 2000s some states began violating the spirit and intention of the act <U+2014> aggressively purging voter rolls, failing to register voters in communities of color, and ignoring accommodation requirements for the disabled. https://t.co/gMvx0GvwJ7

And by 1997 our country was on its way towards that goal. Voter registrations had increased to their highest levels in history. Every state covered by the act was using a uniform voter registration form and all of them were allowing registration by mail. https://t.co/Wi8TdgJM0W

When the bill was introduced and passed the following year, then President Clinton signed it. Voting rights advocates predicted at the time that the number of registered voters would eventually rise to over 90% after passage and implementation. https://t.co/eF27IgbBN6

The fight for passage was long. It was stalled in Congress for over a decade, some years not even making it out of committee <U+2014> the 1 bill that did pass both chambers was vetoed by Pres. Bush for being <U+2018>needless, costly, and constitutionally questionable.<U+201D> https://t.co/X6natmCH4l

26 years ago this week our nation passed the National Voter Registration Act (aka Motor Voter) with the express purpose of increasing <U+201C>the number of eligible citizens who register to vote in elections for Federal office.<U+201D> Its promise is still unfulfilled. https://t.co/m1AaeobEct
I love South Bend https://t.co/ygrMPb2REq
Buddy was very excited to watch dad on TV last night. https://t.co/m6uZXuwJGh
The next president has got to establish a higher bar for what it will take to deploy military force. https://t.co/gyMV1FP5ry

Our campaign is about forging a generational alliance of people of all ages who are focused on the future and believe it is time for a new generation to step forward.

https://t.co/cjMY8CC1ow

You don't have to like it, but one of the reasons we serve was to defend the right of peaceful protest and the idea that we can protest what is wrong with our country.

https://t.co/T5SunDY3Oi

Pardoning war criminals, after or even before they have been tried by a jury of their military peers, would undermine order and discipline, corrode the foundation of American moral authority, and put future troops at risk.
https://t.co/HKHCxqX1Qg

Disabled students are twice as likely to be expelled and are more likely to be referred to the police, putting them in the same school-to-prison pipeline that ensnares students of color. Our kids deserve accommodation, not incarceration.

Harvey Milk would have been 89 today. 

We are forever indebted to him for showing the world what an out LGBTQ elected leader could do <U+2014> a local official with global impact. Hope will never be silenced. #HarveyMilkDay

Happy 154th Birthday to the City of South Bend! #HomeTown https://t.co/Jof5ZgyyqW

El pa<U+00ED>s m<U+00E1>s poderoso del mundo no deber<U+00ED>a temerle a un ni<U+00F1>o que huye de la violencia, y m<U+00E1>s importante a<U+00FA>n, un ni<U+00F1>o que huye de la violencia no le deber<U+00ED>a temer al pa<U+00ED>s m<U+00E1>s poderoso del mundo.  https://t.co/g4dLYlQ2hT

The places that attack women's reproductive rights are the same places where it's hard to get a living wage, and the same places where you're seeing voter suppression that seems to be directed at communities of color. All of these things are connected. #StopTheBans https://t.co/nfh16XbMtK

Bullies want to get a reaction out of you because something else in their life isn't going well. It matters that we elect a president who doesn<U+2019>t show that kind of behavior. https://t.co/aa0Fv0yttL

Muhlaysia Booker is the 4th black trans woman murdered this year, but I fear she won't be the last<U+2014>at least 26 were murdered last year alone. I<U+2019>m praying for her family, but that's not enough. We need action to end these brutal attacks.

None of us are free until we<U+2019>re all free. https://t.co/J2o6Nyu4hK

Girls like C<U+2019>alra are often judged prematurely, punished more harshly, and hamstrung by stereotypes older than this country <U+2014> we must reverse the damage of past and present racism.
https://t.co/M67gzVHgOP

We are living on one of those blank pages in between chapters in American history. What comes next could be ugly <U+2013> or it could be amazing.

I hope you<U+2019>ll join me in making sure that the next era is better than any that we<U+2019>ve had so far: 

https://t.co/6XMmFwIzM4 https://t.co/MNzvTjz9NA

The flag I wore on my shoulder represented a country that was known for keeping its word. But with the president considering pardoning war criminals even after they have been tried by a jury of their peers, that is undermining American moral authority and putting troops at risk. https://t.co/84OMsTIIyT

Even though some of these hosts are not always there in good faith, I think a lot of people tune into this network in good faith. 

Whether it<U+2019>s going on Fox or going into places where Democrats haven<U+2019>t been seen much, we have to find people where they are<U+2013>not change our values. https://t.co/xNHoD0uzE4

The way folks responded to the Fox News Town Hall tonight shows that we can connect with people anywhere while standing firm on our values. Help us build a campaign that can compete everywhere and change the conversation: 

https://t.co/BpTHCPkGql https://t.co/Xs0YmP4A1F
We have to make it less about him and more about what matters. That's the best way to defeat him. https://t.co/2PxuncQ6bW

I believe it is an American freedom that should be enjoyed by women in every state. The next president needs to be ready to protect those rights. https://t.co/NM5IJkO9GO

"There is a reason why anyone has to swallow hard and think twice" before going on Fox, he says.

Buttigieg on abortion in Fox News town hall: "I believe that the right of a woman to make her own decisions about her own reproductive health and her own body is a national right, I believe it is an American freedom."

Tune into @foxnews at 7 PM ET for @PeteButtigieg<U+2019>s town hall with Chris Wallace. Should be some quality TV!

Wishing a speedy recovery to President Carter, and we will be praying for and thinking of him and Mrs. Carter today.

Our progress is hard-won. We must not go back to the days when South Bend would see 20 or more homicides in a year. And we dare not let up until the day comes when we get to zero. If you care, you can help.
Keeping violence from going back up--and driving it further down--requires action. The actions we have taken, and more to come.
I am sick of being notified of violent actions in our city. I am sick of prayers, press conferences, and platitudes. I am particularly sick of consoling parents burying children.

If you are commenting on social media about violence and safety in our community, I hope that means you are willing to take one of these steps, or another I didn't think to list, to help confront this issue. It's not just for government to handle; it's all hands on deck.

Specifically, you can: share info with law enforcement, join community anti-violence events, help recruit talented and diverse new officers, mentor local youth, support the Group Violence Intervention, host a community policing event, help Goodwill create alternatives, & more.

Last year we lost nine residents to gun violence. Last night we lost the first this year: a 16-year-old boy. We continue to do everything we know how to end gun violence, even with a hand tied behind our back. This is an all-hands on deck issue. If you care, you can help.

Five thousand bucks from @dominos isn't going to cut it. We have tens of millions in unmet funding needs. We need a serious plan for funding the roads of the future--ideally one that also encourages climate security instead of penalizing it.
Given that we are now making electric vehicles in our state, you'd think we might want to encourage this sort of thing too. https://t.co/HtXEq6UbDf
To be fair, this is hardly unique to our state. But most states have some kind of offsetting incentive to encourage adoption of electric vehicles. https://t.co/emOkroirjo

But we all know this is not a long-term or sustainable plan, nor does it generate enough revenue to truly fund our roads. And mayors (who are held accountable for road conditions no matter what the state does to our funding) are looking for a better answer.

More logical would be finding a better way to pay for roads in this state. I crossed party lines to praise a GOP bill that adjusted the gas tax a couple years ago, because it helped us pay for repaving and repairs.

The theory here is this: our roads are funded with the gas tax. If you buy less gas, you pay less gas tax. Ergo, if you're burning less fuel, you should pay more. In its way, it's sort of logical. https://t.co/4LM2UYe6ul

By a margin of many millions, Americans called for change--and we are beginning, but only beginning, to see it descend on Washington. The people can't be denied forever.
Yes, we are a republic--a democratic one. If we care about democracy, then we will always pay attention to the will of the people expressed by the majority of American voters.
It is the overall will of the American electorate. It didn't get its way altogether, but it's how the House came back into balance even in the face of nakedly manipulated districts.
Lots of frantic arm-waving on Twitter about how there's no such thing as a House/Senate popular vote. You bet there is, and it matters--that's why they're denying it so hard.
Remarkable gains for just two years, especially in the face of gerrymandering. But there are mountains yet to climb. https://t.co/S5qDaQBnry
We just made our government more Democratic. The next test will be whether we can make it more democratic.

For the rest: hopefully you were there in the trenches with us when we were confronting his worst policies here in Indiana. There will be more where that came from.

I often fought and disagreed with him. I also think certain patterns have arisen in his behavior since he became VP that are new and different from how he acted before. Subtlety isn't popular here on Twitter, but I think it's important to study these changes over time.

Many people here can't get their heads around the idea that someone could be homophobic, fanatical, and wrong, make terrible decisions, and also be sincere. Did he make horrible policy on HIV and many other matters? Yes. Did it destroy lives? Yes. Was it sincere? Yes.

South Bend's (and America's) drop in violence compared to the 1990s didn't just happen on its own. It took sustained community action. Reversing the current trend toward younger victims will require the same. We must study what works and build on it. And everyone has a role.
If you are equally heartbroken by reports of gun violence, ask how you can be part of the solution. Mentor. Volunteer. Participate. Visit. Learn. Help.

But more than any one policy or program, we need community and cultural answers. All of us can help to break the cycles of isolation of the most at-risk (half a percent or so) young people who account for nearly all gun violence.

Even in a state that restricts us from locally enacting popular, constitutional, and evidence-based policies related to access to guns, we can (and do) act at the local level, from civilian street outreach to enforcement actions against violent groups.

We have worked to address violence through every known means, from law enforcement coordination to mentorship and employment support. Yet amid the routine statistical ups and downs, there is more and more heartbreak involving teenagers.
All gun violence is infuriating, but there is a deeper anguish when it involves young people. Our entire community has a role to play in breaking cycles of violence for those most at risk.
